availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.idno: Box 14, Folder 1st INDEPENDENT BTRY LT. ARTY MISCELLANEOUS

body.p:
Department of the Ohio,
ASSISTANT ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Lexington, Ky., March 8th, 1864.
Special Orders,
No. 65

2,, ,, Private Samuel A. Miller Co. "B" 2nd Reg't Minn. Infy Volunteers, is hereby discharged the service, to date from the 1st day of January, 1864, to enable him to accept a Commission, then tendered him by the Governor of Kentucky -- and since when he has been acting in the capacity of a Commissioned Officer.

By Command of Major General Schofield
J. Bates Dickson
Assistant Adjutant General.
Gov. Ky.

5 Batty
2 Minn
Samuel A Miller
Private
Order discharging him to accept com. tendered by the Govr of Ky --
Recd A. G. O. Mar 9. 1864
